general:
This screen allows you to enter the information for creating your publication.

On this page, you can:

  • Click on next to the item you want to enter or update a piece of information,
  • Click the Preview button above to see how this page will look to the public with your changes so far, or
  • Click on the Save button above to save the changes to your draft and come back to this later.

Click to the right of each field to edit

title.label: Title
title.general:
The Title is the name you give this resource.

Enter a title in plain language with enough detail to aid users when searching for it.

If you select a title similar to a related paper, make sure it sufficiently describes the resource as a standalone object.
title.edit: Type the title into the input box and then click the icon to save.

authors.label: Authors
authors.general:
Authors are the creators and collaborators for this resource.

Enter all authors and collaborators for this work. You may want to refer to one of the 14 roles listed in the Credit Contributor Roles Taxonomy. Add affiliations and ORCIDs as available.
authors.list: Click to add authors. Click to make edits.
authors.edit:
Click to save changes.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
authors.dragdrop: To change the order of authors listed, click on on the left of each name, drag it to the right place in the list, and release the mouse button to drop it in place.

contactPoint.label: Contact Point
contactPoint.general:
The Contact Point is the NIST employee who can respond to customer questions about this resource.

Select the contact from dropdown list of NIST employees.
contactPoint.edit:
Click to save changes.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]

landingPage.label: Visit Home Page
landingPage.general:
The Home Page is the users' entry point for a resource.

Enter a URL for a site which provides contextual information and access to the resource (e.g. download links). You can leave this box blank if you want the NIST Public Data Repository record to serve as your Home Page.

Important note: The DOI (digital object identifier) will point to this URL.
landingPage.edit:
Enter a working URL for a homepage other than this repository landing page. Click to save changes

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]

version.label: Version
version.general:
The Versions that appear indicate versions of the publication record. Versions are expressed with three numerical digits.

The last digit, or digit on the right, indicates the number of changes to the record metadata only.

The middle digit indicates changes to the data or digital asset itself, e.g. a file change or file addition.

The first digit, or left digit, indicates a change requested by the author, e.g. a custom number that expresses a specific change the author wishes to describe.

Note: to see notation for version changes, click on the plus '+' sign next to the version number.

description.label: Description
description.general:
The Description of the resource enables users to quickly identify whether it is of interest to them.

Enter informtion that imparts defines and characterizes the resource in enough detail to enable users to determine its usefulness. You may wish to use part of the abstract of a related publication for the description.

It is best to avoid copying the entire abstract if the entirety is not relevant to this discrete resource.
description.edit:
Click to save.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]

theme.label: Research Topics
theme.general:
The Theme is the main category of this resource.

Select one or more Themes from the NIST Research Taxonomy that relate to this resource.
theme.add:
Click to select topics for this resource. Click on the arrows to view subtopics. Double-click on a topic to select it for your resource.Â 

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
theme.edit:
To edit your Research Topics selections, click on . Double click on topics to add them. Click to the right of topics to delete them.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]

keyword.label: Keywords
keyword.general:
Keywords are tags or terms that help users find your resource.

Enter terms that would be useful for both technical and non-technical users. Separate the terms with commas. There is a limit of 4000-characters.
keyword.add:
Click to save.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
keyword.edit:
Click to edit your keywords or enter additional keywords. Separate the terms with commas.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]

components.label: Access Page
components.general:
You are in the Data Access section where you provide links to download the resource or to related sites.

Enter URLs for sites that are related this resource, e.g. a GitHub repository. Each entry requires the URL, the 'Link text' or Title, and information 'About this link' or a description.

Note: this area is not for links to files. To upload and link files use the 'Files' button below.
components.list: Click to enter URLs to sites with information related to this resource. Click to make edits.
components.add:
Separate each URL with a comma. When all URLS are entered, click to save.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
components.edit: Separate each URL with a comma. When all URLS are entered, click to save.
components.dragdrop: To change the order of URLs listed, click on on the left of each link, drag it to the right place in the list, and release the mouse button to drop it in place.

references.label: References
references.general:
References point to related documents such as technical information about this resource, developer documentation, a related publication, etc.

Enter URLs links to these related resources.
references.list: Click to add the URI of a related resource. Click to make changes to existing References listed here.
references.add:
Separate each Reference URL with a comma. When all References are entered, click to save.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
references.edit:
Separate each Reference URL with a comma. When all References are entered, click to save.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
references.dragdrop:
To change the order of references listed, click on on the left of each reference, drag it to the right place in the list, and release the mouse button to drop it in place.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
